purpleculture_pinyin:
chǒng
to love; to pamper; to spoil; to favor
любить; побаловать; испортить; в пользу
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 宠)
Pictophonetic: 龍 indicates the sound; 宀 (roof) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
寵物 [ chǒng wù ]: house pet
寵愛 [ chǒng ài ]: to dote on sb
寵兒 [ chǒng ér ]: pet; favorite; darling

    • 龍 [ lóng ] dragon; symbol of the emperor
heisig_chinese_memo: The family likes to dote on (shower with love) their house dragon which is starting to get too big to fit in the living room.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the dragon (龍) under the roof (宀) gives you affection

humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from "宀", " dragon " sound. "宀" is a symbol of meaning, and the original meaning of the character is unknown. The word "宀" is mostly related to the house. The original meaning of " pet " is to sit in a house honorably (Xu Shen, Zhang Shunhui). "Shuowen": "Favorite, respect your residence. Congluo, dragon sound." Zhang Shunhui, "Shuowen Jiezi Yue Zhu": "Ancient people say that they live, but people say that they sit still today, and they are like a seated person. The Chong Ye." Press "The Analects. Yang goods ":" home, my female language (Ru) "of" living "that is" sitting "means. Duan Yucai, "Shuowen Jiezi Zhu": "Extension is a favorite of honor"

Jin Wen expresses grace, Liang Qizhong: "Use the emperor to spoil Liang Qi 𤯌." It means that the emperor loves Liang Qi and encourages him. "easy. "Teacher": "Cheng Tian Chong Ye", "Classic Interpretation" quoted Zheng Xuan's note: "Chong, Guang Yao Ye." Also used as a personal name, Zeng Bo Cong Chong Ding: "Zeng Bai (Bo) Chong Chong Zi Zha (made) Bao Tripod."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period express their favor, "Sleeping Tiger Land. Japanese Book A Type, Jane 144: "Wuschen gives birth to children, and you have pets." By extension, people who are favored are also called " pets ", "Shanghai Bamboo Book VI. "Jing Gong Malaria" Jane 9: "Internal pets are condemned, and foreign pets are condemned by Liangqiu." Both Hui condemned and Liangqiu are the favored subjects of Qi Jinggong.

Bronze text borrows " dragon " as " favor ". Chi Fu Zhong: "Do not show the light of the dragon", that is, "Pi shows the light of favor" (Yu Shengwu), which expresses great grace and glory. "poetry. Xiaoya. "Liao Xiao": "For the dragon and for the light", Mao Heng's biography: "Dragon, beloved." Zheng Xuanjian: "The emperor's grace is glorious and he is taken."

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period follow the " dragon " and the " heart ", and may be made for the " pet " of grace and favor, and express the meaning of favor from the heart. "Guodian Chu Jian. "Lao Zi B" Jane 5-6: "Human humiliation is like humiliation (shock), and the expensive is like the body." This word is the same character as the " 𢤲 " which means quick and hasty "𢤲" in later generations.

Han silk books also borrow " dragon " as " favor ", "Mawangdui. The 113th line of Laozi Jiaben: "Dragon shame is as frightening, and expensive is like body. Strict (what) stomach (that) dragon shame is as frightened? Dragon is down, gain is as frightened, lose [it] if frightened, yes The stomach (that is) the dragon's disgrace is scary." Wang Bi's "Laozi" is "spoiled and disgraceful."

In addition, "Guodianjian‧Laoziyi" quoted "𢤲 humiliation Ruoying (surprise)", Bai Yulan believed that it should be interpreted as "favoring humiliation Ruoying". Based on this, Qiu Xigui further preached "favor and humiliation" as "favor and humiliation", and reiterated that both "favor and humiliation" and the following "precious trouble" are verbal structures, and "favor and humiliation" are exactly the same as "precious Echoing from back and forth. The intention is to subvert the common people’s habit of loving " prosperity " and disgusting " humiliation ", and " body " (life) and fear of "great tribulation" (death), so as to persuade the world to "spoil and humiliate like ordinary people do." It’s as expensive as your own body." Once Qiu's theory was established, it has always interpreted the phrase "favored to be shocked" as an idea of criticizing the world, which suddenly became a serious misunderstanding of the profound meaning behind Lao Tzu's words!
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from "宀", " dragon " sound. "宀" is a symbol of meaning, like a house, and the original meaning of " pet " is to sit in the house honorably (Xu Shen, Zhang Shunhui).
humanum_full_description:
金文從「宀」，「龍」聲。「宀」是意符，造字本義不明。從「宀」的字多與房屋有關，疑「寵」的本義是尊貴地坐在屋中(許慎、張舜徽)。《說文》：「寵，尊居也。从宀，龍聲。」張舜徽《說文解字約注》：「古人言居，猶今人言坐，尊居猶云尊坐，謂其位之崇也。」按《論語．陽貨》：「居，吾語女(汝)」的「居」即是「坐」的意思。段玉裁《說文解字注》：「引伸為榮寵」。

　　金文表示恩寵，梁其鐘：「用天子寵蔑梁其𤯌。」表示天子寵愛梁其並勉勵他。《易．師》：「承天寵也」，《經典釋文》引鄭玄注：「寵，光耀也。」又用作人名，曾伯從寵鼎：「曾白(伯)從寵自乍(作)寶鼎用。」

　　戰國竹簡表示寵愛，《睡虎地．日書甲種》簡144正：「戊辰生子，有寵。」引申之，受寵幸的人也稱「寵」，《上博竹書六．競公瘧》簡9：「內寵有會譴，外寵有梁丘據。」會譴、梁丘據都是齊景公的寵臣。

　　金文借「龍」為「寵」，遲父鐘：「不顯龍光」，即「丕顯寵光」(于省吾)，表示大大的恩寵和榮耀。《詩．小雅．蓼蕭》：「為龍為光」，毛亨傳：「龍，寵也。」鄭玄箋：「言天子恩澤光耀被及己也。」

　　戰國竹簡從「龍」從「心」，可能是為恩寵、寵愛的「寵」而造的，從心以示寵愛之意。《郭店楚簡．老子乙》簡5-6：「人𢤲辱若纓(驚)，貴大患若身。」此字與後世表示急速、倉促的「𢤲怱」的「𢤲」是同形異字。

　　漢帛書也借「龍」為「寵」，《馬王堆．老子甲本》第113行：「龍辱若驚，貴大梡若身。苛(何)胃(謂)龍辱若驚？龍之為下，得之若驚，失[之]若驚，是胃(謂)龍辱若驚。」王弼本《老子》作「寵辱若驚」。

　　又《郭店簡‧老子乙》上引「𢤲辱若纓(驚)」一語，白于藍認為應釋為「寵辱若䁝」。裘錫圭則據此進一步把「寵辱若䁝」訓為「寵辱若榮」，並重申「寵辱」與下文「貴大患」均為動賓結構，而且「寵辱若榮」正好與「貴大患若身」前後呼應。其用意是要顛覆常人喜愛「榮」而厭惡「辱」，和貴悅「身」(生)而畏懼「大患」(死)的習性，從而誘勸世人應「像常人寵榮那樣寵辱，和像貴身那樣貴大患」。裘說一旦成立，則歷來把「寵辱若驚」一語解為批評俗世之想法，頓成為對老子此語背後深刻用意的嚴重曲解！
humanum_short_description: 金文從「宀」，「龍」聲。「宀」是意符，象房屋，疑「寵」的本義是尊貴地坐在屋中(許慎、張舜徽)。

寵字的基本解释

寵
chǒng
见“宠”。

寵字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chǒng］
［《廣韻》丑隴切，上腫，徹。］
“宠1”的繁体字。
(1)恩宠，宠爱。
(2)指受宠爱的人。后世多指姬妾。
(3)贵宠；荣耀。
(4)指显耀的官职。
(5)尊崇。
(6)特指皇帝所施。参见“寵授”、“寵勞”、“寵賜”等。
(7)用于敬词。参见“寵攜”、“宠誨”、“寵訪”等。
(8)骄纵；骄奢。
(9)超越，胜过。
(10)姓。晋有宠遵。见《晋书·隐逸传·陶潜》。

寵字的康熙字典解释

【寅集上】【宀字部】　寵； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页293第07
【唐韻】丑壟切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】丑勇切，?沖上聲。【說文】尊居也。从宀龍聲。一曰愛也，恩也。又【增韻】尊榮也。【易·師卦】承天寵也。【書·泰誓】惟其克相，上帝寵綏四方。【周官】居寵思危。　又姓。【正字通】蜀漢長史寵義。　又古借龍。【詩·商頌】何天之龍。【周頌】我龍受之。【鄭註】讀若寵。　又【集韻】盧東切，音籠。都寵，縣名，在九眞郡。

寵字的源字形

字源演变：

金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
寵字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Pet
chǒng
See "pet".
Pet
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［chǒng］
["Guangyun" ugly long cut, swollen on the top, thorough. ]
Traditional characters of "宠1".
(1) Grace, love.
(2) Refers to the favored person. Later generations refer to Ji concubine.
(3) Your pet; glory.
(4) Refers to prominent official positions.
(5) Respect.
(6) Specifically refers to what the emperor did. See also "favored", "favored", "favored", etc.
(7) Used for honorific words. See "petting", "petting", "petting visit", etc.
(8) Arrogance; arrogance.
(9) Transcend and surpass.
(10) Last name. Jin You Chong Zun. See "Book of Jin·Hermit Biography·Tao Qian".
Pet
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Yin Ji 1】【Liu Zi Department】　Chong; Kangxi Strokes: 19; Page Number: Page 293 No. 07
[Tang Yun] Ugly Rong Cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Ugly and bravely cut,? Charge up. [Said the text] Respect residence. From the sound of Luo Long. One said love and grace.
